definitions.definition: Able to be expended ; not inexhaustible .
examples: Oil and other expendable resources are frequently the subject of military disputes.

definitions.definition: Designed for a single use; not reusable .
examples: The anti-aircraft rocket is fired from an expendable launch platform.

definitions.definition: Not essential or mandatory in order to achieve a goal.
examples: The research department was deemed expendable , and its funding was not renewed.

definitions.definition: Regarded as not worth preserving or saving; able to be sacrificed .
examples: In the internecine rivalries of large corporations, whole departments may become expendable in the execution of one executive's power play.

main_definition: Able to be expended ; not inexhaustible .
secondary_definitions: Designed for a single use; not reusable .
Not essential or mandatory in order to achieve a goal.
Regarded as not worth preserving or saving; able to be sacrificed .
